data.title: HTML
data.description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the most basic building block of the Web. It defines the meaning and structure of web content.

data.title: CSS
data.description: CSS is the language for describing the presentation of Web pages, including colors, layout, and fonts.

data.title: Javascript
data.description: JavaScript (JS) is a lightweight, interpreted, or just-in-time compiled programming language with first-class functions.

data.title: React JS
data.description: React.js, more commonly known as React, is a free, open-source JavaScript library. It works best to build user interfaces.

data.title: Next JS
data.description: Next.js is a React framework that gives you building blocks to create web applications.

data.title: Node JS
data.description: Node.js (Node) is an open source, cross-platform runtime environment for executing JavaScript code.

data.title: Express JS
data.description: Express is a node js web application framework that provides broad features for building web and mobile applications.

data.title: MongoDB
data.description: MongoDB is a non-relational document database that provides support for JSON-like storage.
